meanings.definition: The quality or state of being rimy.
meanings.sent1: The riminesses of the trees made the whole forest look magical.
meanings.sent2: After the snowfall, the riminesses on the branches sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The children were amazed by the riminesses on the windows, thinking it was fairy dust.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings captured the riminesses of winter, turning them into ethereal scenes.
meanings.sent5: The artist used delicate brushstrokes to depict the riminesses of the landscape.

meanings.definition: The act of covering with rime.
meanings.sent1: The sudden cold snap led to the quick riminesses of the car windshields.
meanings.sent2: The riminesses on the rooftops indicated a frosty morning.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat left tiny paw prints in the riminesses on the car windows.
meanings.sent4: As the temperature dropped, the riminesses spread across the fields like a white blanket.
meanings.sent5: The early morning fog created a mysterious riminesses on the city streets.

meanings.definition: The result of being covered with rime.
meanings.sent1: The hiker's boots were soaked from walking through the riminesses on the trail.
meanings.sent2: The riminesses on the leaves melted away as the sun rose higher in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy rolled around in the riminesses, getting snow all over itself.
meanings.sent4: The old barn had a rustic charm with the riminesses clinging to its wooden walls.
meanings.sent5: The photographer captured the delicate beauty of the riminesses on the flowers.
